medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent abdominal pain lasting for 2 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior to admission with epigastric discomfort and nausea, relieved by several loose bowel movements. Nausea and dizziness persisted with decreased appetite. The patient was able to eat dinner without abdominal pain but experienced band-like epigastric pain radiating to the back and nausea upon awakening at 2 AM on the morning of admission.
medical_history.family_history: Parents alive & well. No known history of cancer or heart disease.
medical_history.social_history: No recent alcohol use. No sick contacts.
